snippet: Miguel Cabrera was always a prodigy, and now he has become the first player to sweep baseball’s triple crown categories in almost half a century.
abstract: Detroit Tigers third baseman Miguel Cabrera becomes first player in nearly half a century to win baseball's triple crown, leading the American League in home runs (44), batting average (.330) and runs batted in (139); the last player to accomplish the feat was Carl Yastrzemski of the Boston Red Sox in 1967.
lead_paragraph: Miguel Cabrera was always a prodigy, and now he has become the first player to sweep baseball’s triple crown categories in almost half a century.

headline.seo: Miguel Cabrera Wins the Triple Crown
headline.main: Drama on Baseball’s Final Day as a Star Completes a Crown
headline.print_headline: Drama on Baseball’s Final Day As a Star Completes a Crown
